# Fascicular Blocks

## Left anterior fascicular block (LAFB)

- EKG criteria:
    -   LAD
    -   'qR complexes' (small Q + tall R) in I, aVL
    -   'rS complexes' (small R + deep S) in II, III, aVF
    -   QRS nml/wide (80-110 ms), but *not* exceeding 120 ms

![LAFB](https://litfl.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Left-Anterior-Fascicular-Block-LAFB-qR-rS-complexes.png)

## Left posterior fascicular block (LPFB)

- EKG criteria:
    - RAD
    - 'qR complexes' (small Q + tall R) in II, III, aVF
    - 'rS complexes' (small R + deep S) in I, aVL
    - QRS nml/wide (80-110 ms), but *not* exceeding 120 ms

### Bifascicular block

- RBBB + fascicular block (LAFB (more common) or LPFB)

### Trifascicular block

- most common: RBBB + fascicular block (LAFB or LPFB) + prolonged PR interval (1st degree AV block)
- others:
    - bifascicular block + 2nd degree AV block
    - bifascicular block + 3rd degree AV block
